overview:
Sarah Kling is CEO of UEVision. With 14 years of experience designing software systems, websites, and web applications, Sarah is a leading authority on designing and delivering the perfect product user experience. Prior to founding UEVision, Sarah served as user experience consultant, usability evangelist, and user experience team leader for a number of B2B and B2C companies. She founded UEVision in 2005 to enable her team to bring world-class user experience strategy and designs to many different organizations and their products, resulting in happier customers, more profitable products, and reduced support costs.

UEVision’s clients have included Oracle, Fujitsu, Blue Shield of California, LeapFrog Enterprises, E*TRADE Financial, SugarCRM, Taleo, Groupon, Visa, and Saba Software, as well as many small and mid-sized companies.

Sarah specializes in designing a world-class user experience by adapting user-focused design practices to the specific requirements of websites, web applications, mobile applications, and software systems and the needs of their users. She has built user experience teams and re-engineered user experience and usability processes for many organizations, and as a result, has led a variety of successful initiatives to integrate usability “best practices” with the product development process to produce enterprise products that are practical, efficient, visually appealing, and highly usable.

Sarah holds an A.B. from Stanford University and has studied usability and human factors at the University of California and U.C.-Santa Cruz. She is a member of the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM), the Usability Professionals Association (UPA), and the Bay Area special interest group in user interface (BayCHI).
